intro: Gouania glandulosa var. breviloba, commonly known as the short-stalked gouania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glandular-stipitate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
